intro: Knautia pectinata, commonly known as the velvet knautia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with hairy, gray-green foliage. Its flowers are pink to purple in color, and they bloom in late summer to early autumn. Knautia pectinata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
